articles.author: James McCarten
articles.title: Despite COVID-19 vaccines, Americans in D.C. not feeling celebratory -- or charitable - CTV News
articles.description: Access to the COVID-19 vaccine in the United States is growing by the day. But the country that just months ago was the international poster child for how not to respond to a pandemic still doesn't seem to be in a celebratory -- or charitable -- mood.
articles.content:
WASHINGTON --

articles.title: The U.S. is awash in vaccine supply. Its new concern: Will demand keep up? - CBC.ca
articles.description: With some U.S. states now boasting more than one dose of COVID-19 vaccine for every adult, the newest concern involves demand: Will enough Americans get shots to achieve herd immunity?
articles.content:
On the road to mass-vaccination, the U.S. is so far ahead that it's detecting new obstacles that remain, for much of the world, an afterthought on a distant horizon.
The proportion of the U.S. popul… [+8916 chars]

articles.title: Indianapolis’ Sikh community calls for U.S. gun reforms after FedEx shooting - Global News
articles.description: The attack was another blow to the Asian American community a month after authorities said six people of Asian descent were killed by a gunman in the Atlanta area.

articles.title: Will your kids need to be vaccinated? - PAHomePage.com
articles.description: With more than half of Americans now at least partially vaccinated, many are wondering: Will kids need the vaccine, too?
articles.content:

articles.title: Citi's exit from consumer banking is 'no surprise' - The Star Online
articles.description: NEWS that American banking group Citigroup Inc is closing down its consumer banking business in 13 markets, including Malaysia, does not come as a surprise and has ignited fresh concerns that competition in the banking space can only get more heated.
